elements.text: CBTC Mainnet launch runbook
Ferenc Fabian made updates to a canvas tab:

text: I just opened an incident case with the canton CPU loads to IEU: <https://intellecteu.atlassian.net/servicedesk/customer/portal/32/CBM-192?created=true>

elements.text: I just opened an incident case with the canton CPU loads to IEU:

text:
I created the mainnet onboard repository and copied the same from testnet: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-onboarding-mainnet>

We have 3 repostitories dealing with the onboarding:

• Mainnet node operator: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-onboarding-mainnet>
• Testnet node operator: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-onboarding-testnet>
• Internal private: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-onboarding-internal>
The process for the onboarding (ex.: testnet):

• I send out the steps from the testnet reporitory like: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-onboarding-testnet/tree/step1/step1>
    ◦ The steps are clear, has an input and ouput folder, or only an output folder
    ◦ The node operator should check whether the necessary files are in the input folder (it is documented, what to look for)
    ◦ The node operator send us the files from the output folder
• After they send us the files I collect all of them in the internal repository like: <https://github.com/DLC-link/canton-onboarding-internal/tree/main/testnet/step1>
    ◦ I collect the files and run the a and b scala scripts there
• The internal scripts has outputs also, I put them into to input folders of the next step in the testnet repository and then send the step out to the node operators
• Repeat
In the internal I collect the

• step0 data, party IDs, usernames
• Who participate in the progress
• All of the output files of the participants
• All of the output files of the internal scala scripts
• The internal repository for both testnet and mainnet
Notes:
• In the step 1a I just separated the DNS proposals from the Party proposals, because the Party proposals only needed from the step 3.
cc <@U05FU0HPZ9T> <@U088UV6MKFE>

elements.text: I created the mainnet onboard repository and copied the same from testnet:
We have 3 repostitories dealing with the onboarding:
Mainnet node operator:
Testnet node operator:
Internal private:
The process for the onboarding (ex.: testnet):
I send out the steps from the testnet reporitory like:
The steps are clear, has an input and ouput folder, or only an output folder
The node operator should check whether the necessary files are in the input folder (it is documented, what to look for)
The node operator send us the files from the output folder
After they send us the files I collect all of them in the internal repository like:
I collect the files and run the a and b scala scripts there
The internal scripts has outputs also, I put them into to input folders of the next step in the testnet repository and then send the step out to the node operators
Repeat
In the internal I collect the
step0 data, party IDs, usernames
Who participate in the progress
All of the output files of the participants
All of the output files of the internal scala scripts
The internal repository for both testnet and mainnet
Notes:
In the step 1a I just separated the DNS proposals from the Party proposals, because the Party proposals only needed from the step 3.

text: This is great thanks a lot for holding the fort :pinched_fingers: i expected to have more computer time here, but you are killing it anyway!

elements.text: This is great thanks a lot for holding the fort
i expected to have more computer time here, but you are killing it anyway!

text: So I'm the responsible to keep you away from your computer? Shame on me. :smile:

elements.text: So I'm the responsible to keep you away from your computer? Shame on me.

text: If you werent doing such a good job, i could stay on the compjuter instead of climbing Etna :(

elements.text: If you werent doing such a good job, i could stay on the compjuter instead of climbing Etna :(

text: You are few weeks left... Brave people ski Etna on lava.

text: Hi <@U093Q4FPEJG>! BD team had a question for you. Is it possible to issue free credentials programmatically from the Canton Utility?

elements.text: Hi
! BD team had a question for you. Is it possible to issue free credentials programmatically from the Canton Utility?

text: Right now, we have 50 free credentials we want to issue. We could do it manually or via a script

elements.text: Right now, we have 50 free credentials we want to issue. We could do it manually or via a script

text: You mean creating it inside the canton utility?

elements.text: You mean creating it inside the canton utility?

text: I think yes we can do it. How urgent is it? I can deal with this tomorrow.

elements.text: I think yes we can do it. How urgent is it? I can deal with this tomorrow.

text: I can jump in here. Yes we can issue them from a script

elements.text: I can jump in here. Yes we can issue them from a script

text: Is this urgent? I thought we agreed to wait to issue them from the decentralized party - which we can only do after mainnet launch

elements.text: Is this urgent? I thought we agreed to wait to issue them from the decentralized party - which we can only do after mainnet launch

text:
```curl '<https://utility.dev.canton.ibtc.network/api/json-api/v2/commands/submit-and-wait-for-transaction-tree>' \
  -H 'accept: application/json, */*;q=0.8' \
  -H 'accept-language: en-GB,en;q=0.7' \
  -H 'authorization: Bearer eyJh...' \
  -H 'content-type: application/json' \
  -H 'origin: <https://utility.dev.canton.ibtc.network>' \
  -H 'priority: u=1, i' \
  -H 'referer: <https://utility.dev.canton.ibtc.network/credential/credentials>' \
  -H 'sec-ch-ua: "Not)A;Brand";v="8", "Chromium";v="138", "Brave";v="138"' \
  -H 'sec-ch-ua-mobile: ?0' \
  -H 'sec-ch-ua-platform: "Linux"' \
  -H 'sec-fetch-dest: empty' \
  -H 'sec-fetch-mode: cors' \
  -H 'sec-fetch-site: same-origin' \
  -H 'sec-gpc: 1' \
  -H 'user-agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux x86_64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/138.0.0.0 Safari/537.36' \
  --data-raw '{"commands":[{"ExerciseCommand":{"templateId":"#utility-credential-app-v0:Utility.Credential.App.V0.Service.User:UserService","contractId":"00a842f70bf3de081d538240509dcbc1a7b30e8e74b94a6122fc453e2198919fe5ca1112200c3b0da856ae9d4f41ead108e446601a214a706885c2cf78573e5f6712b18b25","choice":"UserService_OfferFreeCredential","choiceArgument":{"holder":"test","id":"test","description":"test","claims":[{"subject":"test","property":"test","value":"test"}]}}}],"workflowId":"","userId":"7039855d-5ce4-4989-a1f2-3a24c5ef18bd","commandId":"6c47c1b098955a0f4ebe1f66ecc667482067df62","deduplicationPeriod":{"DeduplicationDuration":{"value":{"seconds":30,"nanos":0}}},"actAs":["iBTC-validator-1::1220fa8543db6c66fe3a55b1f180c8dfc7f876265c76684fbc1d35d89e02c8aafe8e"],"readAs":[],"submissionId":"da063d1a-5568-4e4a-8ff1-d8d0c627e40f","disclosedContracts":[],"domainId":"","packageIdSelectionPreference":["e4beed1b8ae0506e63d6da04bffb447f8f406261dd64b9abf457c4655d031a6a","8209a411cf3988feeaf56d5534199b54864955f1175e30880628299506c36ea4"]}'```
This is how it creates it.
